data.title: Minnesota Bilingual Seals Program
data.text:
Assessments for Bilingual and Multilingual Seals and World Language Proficiency Certificates

Students must demonstrate proficiency in reading, writing, listening, and speaking in a language other than English. Refer to Minnesota Statutes 2023, section 120B.022 Elective Standards for other seal requirements.

Approved Assessments

American Council on the Teaching of Foreign Languages (ACTFL) Oral Proficiency Interview (OPI) and Reading, Listening and Writing Proficiency Tests

Multiple languages available. However, not all languages have all four modalities available. Be sure to double check before purchasing a test. Find more test information on the Language Testing International website.

ACTFL Assessment of Performance toward Proficiency in Languages (AAPPL)

Languages available include Arabic, Chinese (Mandarin), French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Spanish.

See the AAPPL website for information on future assessments.

ACTFL Latin Interpretive Reading Exam (ALIRA)

Latin

Language Testing – ALIRA (Reading only). Writing, listening, and speaking must also be assessed. Contact the Minnesota Department of Education (MDE) for more information.

Advanced Placement (AP) Language and Culture Exams

Note: 2020 AP exam scores are not accepted. Available languages include Chinese, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Latin, and Spanish.

Learn more about AP Language and Culture exams on the AP website.

American Sign Language

AVANT STAMP 4S Proficiency Assessments

Available languages include Arabic, Chinese (Traditional and Simplified), English, French, German, Hebrew, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Polish, Russian, Spanish.

Learn more about the assessment on the AVANT website. Review the STAMP4S Benchmark Scale for the scores and ACTFL proficiency level equivalencies.

AVANT STAMP WS (formerly WorldSpeak)

Languages that are qualify for Minnesota Bilingual Seals include Amharic, Czech, Hmong, Somali, Swahili, Tamil, Ukrainian, Vietnamese.

AVANT STAMP WS assesses speaking and writing only.

Reading and listening must be assessed as well. Minnesota-developed reading and listening assessments are available only for Amharic, Czech, Hmong, Somali, Swahili, Tamil, Ukrainian, Vietnamese. Visit Extempore webpage for more information.

Note:

Bulgarian Assessment

Bulgarian

The Bulgarian Language Proficiency Assessment is available through:

Diplôme d'études en langue française

The French Language Proficiency Assessment is available through:

Alliance Francaise Minneapolis St. Paul which can be contacted at 612-332-0436 or at certifications@afmsp.org.

High school student may take Junior or Tout Public versions of the exam.

Additional Information:

These exams lead to an official qualification awarded by the French Ministry of Education to certify the competency of candidates from outside France in the French Language. The diplomas are valid for life.

Deutsches Sprachdiplom I & II

German

Ellinomatheia Exams (Certificate of the Attainment in the Greek Language)

Ellinomatheia Exams are available through Hellenic American Academy in Illinois in May. The application period is in early February to mid-March and candidates are encouraged to apply online. Interested candidates must travel to take an exam on the specific days. Contact Ellinomatheia Supervisor Mr. Agapitos Patros (ellinomatheia@haamail.net) or 847-317-1063.

European Consortium for the Certificate of Attainment in Modern Languages (ECL) Exam in the Hungarian language

Hungarian

Assessments take place through the Foreign Language Centre at the University of Pécs in early June and early December. Registration deadlines are a month before the test. Contact Minnesota Hungarians for registration and questions.

IBDP (International Baccalaureate Diploma Program Examination)

Note: 2020 IBDP exam scores are not accepted. 2021 IBDP exam scores will depend on what format students were tested on. Contact MDE for more information.

Available in several languages.
